level.heading: Periodic replacement of carbon monoxide alarms.
level.text: * ยง 28-312.1 Periodic replacement of carbon monoxide alarms. Carbon monoxide alarms required pursuant to section 908.7 of the New York city building code or sections 27-981.1, 27-981.2 and 27-981.3 of the 1968 building code shall be replaced when the time elapsed since the installation of such alarm exceeds the manufacturers suggested useful life of the alarm. Exception. A carbon monoxide alarm installed prior to the effective date of this article shall be replaced when the time elapsed since the installation of such alarm exceeds the manufacturers suggested useful life of the alarm or within 6 months after the effective date of this article, whichever is later. * NB Effective until April 1, 2014 * ยง 28-312.1 General. Required carbon monoxide and smoke alarms shall comply with the provisions of this article. * NB Effective April 1, 2014
